titleStmt.title: Christopher Angell, a Grecian, who tasted of many stripes and torments inflicted by the Turkes for the faith which he had in Christ Iesus
Ponēsis Khristophorou tou Aggelou Hellēnos tou pollōn plēgon. English.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Lichfield, and William Wrench, Printers to the famous Vniversitie,

notesStmt.note: An English translation of: Ponēsis Khristophorou tou Aggelou Hellēnos tou pollōn plēgon.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
